page.title: 01Myherin Forest Cardiganshire
page.content: Lying between 370 and 537m above sea level, myherin Forest was planted some 35 years ago in the vallley of River Mynach, about 14 miles west of Abberystryth in Caadiganshire. Rainfall 1750 to 2500 mm. Some rough grazing in amongst the trees,carrying mainly Welsh mountain sheep and some suckler cows and bullocks. The mixed conifer species are harvested by self employed contractors who supply saw mills for constructional timber, and large quantities of fence posts are sent for pressure preservation treatment. Ministry of Agriculture Pwllpeiran Experimental Husbandry Farm adjoins, developing improved methods of farming the hills. Scenery magnificent (Plynbimmon range to north, the area is popular with summer visitors. The resident populataion is sparse and mainly employed locally.
